p: CCoV RNA was first recorded in our wolf samples in 2002, remaining with marked fluctuations over time. Both canid species present similar overall prevalence values. In comparison, the incidence was much lower in Italian and French wolf populations using faecal samples [ 11], which is not surprising given the low stability of viral particles in scats [ 45]. CCoV RNA has been detected in dog tissues across Europe [ 46], but despite previous efforts, only a single positive mongoose has been recorded in Portugal [ 10]. Thus, our results represent the first record of viral infections in wild populations of C. lupus and V. vulpes in Iberia, as well as for L. lutra and G. genetta.
